snippet: Revenue dropped at the weapons manufacturer, which predicted that reductions in military spending would translate to lower profit and sales in 2012.
abstract: Northrop Grumman predicts reductions in military spending will mean lower profit and sales in 2012; reports fourth-quarter profit of $550 million, or $2.09 a share, up 80 percent from $306 million, or $1.03 a share, in the year-ago quarter; revenue fell 5.7 percent to $6.5 billion from $6.9 billion.
lead_paragraph: Revenue dropped at the weapons manufacturer, which predicted that reductions in military spending would translate to lower profit and sales in 2012.

headline.seo: Profit Rises, but Sales Fall at Northrop Grumman
headline.main: Profit Increases, but Revenue Falls at Northrop
headline.print_headline: Profit Increases, but Revenue Falls at Northrop
